Three Mile Island: Labor Issues Files
WAG.184
WAG.184
circa 1979

This small collection contains material on actions by unions and other labor groups regarding the partial meltdown of a nuclear reactor at Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station in Dauphin County, Pennsylvania, and efforts to improve conditions and employment in the energy and construction industries. The main actions covered in the collection are the first National Labor Conference for Safe Energy and Full Employment held in Pittsburgh in 1980 and the national march for safe energy and jobs in Harrisburg in 1981. The collection contains correspondence, clippings, maps, and many fliers.
The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.141.
